SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.vertex

Class Vertex

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector3
civitas.celestis.math.vertex.Vertex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Vector, Serializable
public class Vertex extends Vector3
A three-dimensional vector used to represent graphical data. Like Vector3, this class is also immutable.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • fromObjTuple

      @Nonnull public static Vertex fromObjTuple(@Nonnull de.javagl.obj.FloatTuple in)
      Converts a Wavefront FloatTuple to a Moebius Vertex. This swaps the X and Z components to compensate for the differences in coordinate systems.
      Parameters:
      in - The input tuple
      Returns:
      The converted vertex

    • transform

      @Nonnull public Vertex transform(@Nonnull Vector3 origin, @Nonnull Quaternion rotation, double scale)
      Transforms this vertex to a relative coordinate system, and adds inflation to better represents its size in a graphical context.
      Parameters:
      origin - The new origin of this vertex
      rotation - The rotation to apply to this vertex
      scale - The scale factor of the inflation
      Returns:
      The transformed vertex

    • absolute

      @Nonnull public Vertex absolute(@Nonnull Vector3 offset, @Nonnull Quaternion rotation)
      Transforms this vertex to an absolute coordinate system. This is used to translate local coordinates into absolute coordinates.
      Parameters:
      offset - The offset of the local coordinate system's origin relative to absolute zero
      rotation - The rotation to apply before translating
      Returns:
      The absolute coordinates of this vertex

    • parseVertex

      @Nonnull public static Vertex parseVertex(@Nonnull String input) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Deserializes a string into a Vertex.
      Parameters:
      input - The input to deserialize
      Returns:
      The parsed vertex
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - When the format is invalid
      IllegalArgumentException - When at least one of the component scalars is non-finite
